text: James "Jim" Ross (May 20, 1926 - January 1, 2016) was a Scottish-Canadian professional ice hockey player. He played as a defenceman from 1944 until 1955. He played 62 games in the National Hockey League (NHL) for the New York Rangers. Ross was born in Edinburgh. He later moved to Toronto, Ontario, Canada. His wife, Margaret, died in 2008. They had four children. Ross died on January 1, 2016 in Woodstock, Ontario, aged 89. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1926 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey defencemen Category:New York Rangers players Category:Ice hockey people from Toronto
title: Jim Ross (ice hockey)
